description: a(n+1) = le nombre des lettres dans a(n).
comments: a(1) = 1; for n>1, a(n) = numbers of letters in French name for a(n-1).The English (1, 3, 5, 4, 4, 4, ...) and German (1, 4, 4, 4, ...) versions are less interesting.Memo: 13847/1111 = 12.4635463546354635... - _Eric Angelini_, Sep 17 2006
example: Un, deux, quatre, six, trois, cinq, quatre, ...UN (2 letters), DEUX (4 letters), QUATRE (6 letters), SIX (3 letters), TROIS (5 letters), CINQ (4 letters), QUATRE (6 letters), ...
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 14 2001
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of _Andrew Plewe_, Jun 08 2007
